answer.p: x_2=x_1, y_2=-y_1, and r_2=r_1. Thus, \cos(-\alpha)=\dfrac{x_2}{r_2} =\dfrac{x_1}{r_1}=\cos\alpha , \sin(-\alpha)=\dfrac{y_2}{r_2} =\dfrac{-y_1}{r_1}=-\sin\alpha , and \tan(-\alpha)=\dfrac{y_2}{x_2} =\dfrac{-y_1}{x_1}=-\tan\alpha .
